instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.BUTTON_DISABLE: What is BUTTON_DISABLE? BUTTON_DISABLE disables the trackpad when SMC_LID is below 0.5v and the system believes the lid is closed. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> had minor water damage. Replaced <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>, J5800, and  <CHIP>U4510</CHIP>. Turns on and recognizes keyboard and clicking works on trackpad but trackpad itself does not track. Tried known good track pad and cable

18V on <RESISTOR>R5806</RESISTOR>

What to try next? Can <CHIP>U5701</CHIP> still be to blame even though clicking and keyboard work?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>BUTTON_DISABLE</SIGNAL> signals.
Also check continuity between J5800 and <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>.
If all good, change <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no trackpad
